pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, February 24, 2022 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

National Capital Region, Canada

Private meetings

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Leaders’ Meeting, hosted by the Chancellor of Germany, Olaf Scholz.

Closed to media

The Prime Minister will speak with the President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and hold a media availability on the situation in Ukraine with Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Chrystia Freeland, Minister of National Defence Anita Anand, and Minister of Foreign Affairs Mélanie Joly.

Room 100
Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Participation in the question and answer portion of this event is for accredited members of the Parliamentary Press Gallery only. Media who are not members of the Parliamentary Press Gallery may contact pressres2@parl.gc.ca for temporary access.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-960-7518
    Toll-free: 1-866-805-7923
    Pass code: 5110196#

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend and deliver remarks at the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation’s National Housing Supply Summit.

Closed to media

8:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a roundtable with leaders from the Black community in Edmonton, Alberta. Minister of Tourism and Associate Minister of Finance Randy Boissonnault and Minister for Women and Gender Equality and Youth Marci Ien will be present.

Media interested in watching the event live can contact media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca for details.
